intro: Platycentrum clidemioides subsp. boliviense, commonly known as the Bolivian starflower, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often vibrant flowers. The species is characterized by its clustered, star-like flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or alpine habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
